summary: This bill, the Accelerating Kids’ Access to Care Act of 2025, aims to streamline the enrollment process for eligible out-of-state healthcare providers under Medicaid and CHIP. It amends the Social Security Act to allow these providers to enroll more easily, specifying a 5-year enrollment period and defining 'eligible out-of-state provider' and 'qualifying individual'. The bill intends to improve access to care for children enrolled in these programs.
